[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2012_Pacific_typhoon_season&action=edit&section=14 "Edit section: Typhoon Damrey")]

Typhoon(JMA)
Category 1 typhoon(SSHWS)
[![Image 27](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/6a/Damrey_2012-08-02_0245Z.jpg/250px-Damrey_2012-08-02_0245Z.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Damrey_2012-08-02_0245Z.jpg)[![Image 28](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ac/Damrey_2012_track.png/250px-Damrey_2012_track.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Damrey_2012_track.png)
Duration July 27– August 4
Peak intensity 130 km/h (80 mph) (10-min);

965[hPa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pascal_(unit) "Pascal (unit)")([mbar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bar_(unit) "Bar (unit)"))

Main article: [Typhoon Damrey (2012)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Typhoon_Damrey_(2012) "Typhoon Damrey (2012)")

Originally a [cold-core low](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cold-core_low "Cold-core low"), the system became a tropical disturbance southwest of [Minamitorishima](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Minamitorishima "Minamitorishima") late on July 26. Early on July 27, the [Japan Meteorological Agency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan_Meteorological_Agency "Japan Meteorological Agency") (JMA) upgraded it to a tropical depression.[[189]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-190) On July 28, the [Joint Typhoon Warning Center](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joint_Typhoon_Warning_Center "Joint Typhoon Warning Center") (JTWC) issued a [Tropical Cyclone Formation Alert](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tropical_Cyclone_Formation_Alert "Tropical Cyclone Formation Alert") on the system, before the JMA upgraded it to a tropical storm and named it _Damrey_.[[190]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-191)[[191]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-192) Late on the same day, the JTWC upgraded Damrey to a tropical depression, and even upgraded it to a tropical storm on the next day.[[192]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-193)[[193]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-194) After Damrey had drifted slowly for two days, the JMA upgraded it to a severe tropical storm northeast of [Chichi-jima](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chichi-jima "Chichi-jima") late on July 30, when the storm began to accelerate moving west-northwest and form a banding eye.[[194]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-195) On August 1, the JTWC upgraded Damrey to a category 1 typhoon, while the system passed through the [Ōsumi Islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C5%8Csumi_Islands "Ōsumi Islands") in Japan, as it started to develop a well defined eye.[[195]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-196) When Damrey drifted towards [Yellow Sea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yellow_Sea "Yellow Sea") on August 2, the JMA upgraded it to a typhoon.[[196]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-197) Soon, Typhoon Damrey made landfall over [Xiangshui County](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xiangshui_County "Xiangshui County") in [Jiangsu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jiangsu "Jiangsu"), China at 13:30 [UTC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time "Coordinated Universal Time") (21:30 [CST](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time_in_China#People's_Republic_of_China "Time in China")).[[197]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-198) Late on August 2, the JTWC downgraded Damrey to a tropical storm with a final warning,[[198]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-199) with the JMA downgrading it to a severe tropical storm.[[199]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-200) By August 3, the JMA downgraded Damrey to a tropical depression when it was located in [Shandong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shandong "Shandong").[[200]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-201) The system then dissipated near [Hebei](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hebei "Hebei") on August 4.[[201]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-202)

triples.sentence: Early on July 27, the [Japan Meteorological Agency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan_Meteorological_Agency "Japan Meteorological Agency") (JMA) upgraded it to a tropical depression.[[189]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-190)
triples.statement: Early on July 27, the Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) upgraded the system to a tropical depression.

triples.sentence: On July 28, the [Joint Typhoon Warning Center](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joint_Typhoon_Warning_Center "Joint Typhoon Warning Center") (JTWC) issued a [Tropical Cyclone Formation Alert](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tropical_Cyclone_Formation_Alert "Tropical Cyclone Formation Alert") on the system, before the JMA upgraded it to a tropical storm and named it _Damrey_.[[190]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-191)[[191]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-192)
triples.statement: On July 28, the Joint Typhoon Warning Center (JTWC) issued a Tropical Cyclone Formation Alert on the system, after which the JMA upgraded it to a tropical storm and named it Damrey.

triples.sentence: Late on the same day, the JTWC upgraded Damrey to a tropical depression, and even upgraded it to a tropical storm on the next day.[[192]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-193)[[193]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-194)
triples.statement: Late on the same day, the JTWC upgraded Damrey to a tropical depression, and then to a tropical storm the following day.

triples.sentence: After Damrey had drifted slowly for two days, the JMA upgraded it to a severe tropical storm northeast of [Chichi-jima](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chichi-jima "Chichi-jima") late on July 30, when the storm began to accelerate moving west-northwest and form a banding eye.[[194]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-195)
triples.statement: After drifting slowly for two days, Damrey was upgraded to a severe tropical storm by the JMA late on July 30, at which point it began to accelerate west-northwest and form a banding eye.

triples.sentence: On August 1, the JTWC upgraded Damrey to a category 1 typhoon, while the system passed through the [Ōsumi Islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C5%8Csumi_Islands "Ōsumi Islands") in Japan, as it started to develop a well defined eye.[[195]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-196)
triples.statement: On August 1, the JTWC upgraded Damrey to a category 1 typhoon as it passed through the Ōsumi Islands in Japan and began to develop a well-defined eye.

triples.sentence: When Damrey drifted towards [Yellow Sea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yellow_Sea "Yellow Sea") on August 2, the JMA upgraded it to a typhoon.[[196]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-197)
triples.statement: As Damrey moved towards the Yellow Sea on August 2, the JMA upgraded it to a typhoon.

triples.sentence: Soon, Typhoon Damrey made landfall over [Xiangshui County](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xiangshui_County "Xiangshui County") in [Jiangsu](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jiangsu "Jiangsu"), China at 13:30 [UTC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time "Coordinated Universal Time") (21:30 [CST](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time_in_China#People's_Republic_of_China "Time in China")).[[197]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-198)
triples.statement: Typhoon Damrey made landfall over Xiangshui County in Jiangsu, China at 13:30 UTC (21:30 CST).

triples.sentence: Late on August 2, the JTWC downgraded Damrey to a tropical storm with a final warning,[[198]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-199) with the JMA downgrading it to a severe tropical storm.[[199]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-200)
triples.statement: Late on August 2, the JTWC downgraded Damrey to a tropical storm and issued a final warning, while the JMA downgraded it to a severe tropical storm.

triples.sentence: By August 3, the JMA downgraded Damrey to a tropical depression when it was located in [Shandong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shandong "Shandong").[[200]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-201)
triples.statement: By August 3, the JMA downgraded Damrey to a tropical depression while it was located in Shandong.

triples.sentence: The system then dissipated near [Hebei](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hebei "Hebei") on August 4.[[201]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-202)
triples.statement: The system dissipated near Hebei on August 4.

section_body:
[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2012_Pacific_typhoon_season&action=edit&section=15 "Edit section: Typhoon Haikui")]

Main article: [Typhoon Haikui (2012)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Typhoon_Haikui_(2012) "Typhoon Haikui (2012)")

Typhoon(JMA)
Category 1 typhoon(SSHWS)
[![Image 29](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7e/Haikui_Aug_6_2012_0220Z.jpg/250px-Haikui_Aug_6_2012_0220Z.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Haikui_Aug_6_2012_0220Z.jpg)[![Image 30](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1d/Haikui_2012_track.png/250px-Haikui_2012_track.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Haikui_2012_track.png)
Duration August 1– August 11
Peak intensity 120 km/h (75 mph) (10-min);

965[hPa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pascal_(unit) "Pascal (unit)")([mbar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bar_(unit) "Bar (unit)"))

Main article: [Typhoon Haikui (2012)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Typhoon_Haikui_(2012) "Typhoon Haikui (2012)")

Late on July 31, a tropical disturbance formed within a large [monsoon trough](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monsoon_trough "Monsoon trough"). On August 1, the [Japan Meteorological Agency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan_Meteorological_Agency "Japan Meteorological Agency") (JMA) mentioned the system as a tropical depression southeast of [Iwo Jima](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iwo_Jima "Iwo Jima"), and the [Joint Typhoon Warning Center](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joint_Typhoon_Warning_Center "Joint Typhoon Warning Center") (JTWC) issued a [Tropical Cyclone Formation Alert](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tropical_Cyclone_Formation_Alert "Tropical Cyclone Formation Alert") late on the same day.[[202]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-203)[[203]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-204) Late on August 2, the JTWC upgraded it to a tropical depression, before the JMA upgraded the system to a tropical storm and named it _Haikui_ early on the next day.[[204]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-205)[[205]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-206) Early on August 4, the JTWC upgraded Haikui to a tropical storm.[[206]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-207) On August 5, the JMA upgraded Haikui to a severe tropical storm when it was located north-northeast of [Kume Island](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kume_Island "Kume Island").[[207]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-208) The JTWC upgraded Haikui to a category 1 typhoon late on August 6, as it developed an eye.[[208]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-209) At 12:00 UTC on August 7, the JMA upgraded Haikui to a typhoon.[[209]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-210) Later, Typhoon Haikui made landfall over [Xiangshan County](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xiangshan_County,_Zhejiang "Xiangshan County, Zhejiang") in [Zhejiang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zhejiang "Zhejiang"), China at 19:20 [UTC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time "Coordinated Universal Time") (03:20 [CST](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/China_time "China time") on August 8).[[210]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-211) Early on August 8, the JMA downgraded Haikui to a severe tropical storm, when the JTWC issued the final warning.[[211]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-212)[[212]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-213) Soon, the JMA downgraded Haikui to a tropical storm.[[213]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-214) Haikui further weakened to a tropical depression on August 9, with the JMA issuing their last advisory on the system.[[214]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-215)

triples.statement: Early on August 8, the JMA downgraded Haikui to a severe tropical storm, at which point the JTWC issued its final warning.

triples.sentence: Soon, the JMA downgraded Haikui to a tropical storm.[[213]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-214)
triples.statement: Soon after, the JMA downgraded Haikui to a tropical storm.

triples.sentence: Haikui further weakened to a tropical depression on August 9, with the JMA issuing their last advisory on the system.[[214]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-215)
triples.statement: On August 9, Haikui weakened to a tropical depression, and the JMA issued its final advisory on the system.

section_body:
[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2012_Pacific_typhoon_season&action=edit&section=16 "Edit section: Severe Tropical Storm Kirogi")]

Severe tropical storm(JMA)
Tropical storm(SSHWS)
[![Image 31](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4a/Kirogi_Aug_9_2012.jpg/250px-Kirogi_Aug_9_2012.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Kirogi_Aug_9_2012.jpg)[![Image 32](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/a3/Kirogi_2012_track.png/250px-Kirogi_2012_track.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Kirogi_2012_track.png)
Duration August 3– August 10
Peak intensity 95 km/h (60 mph) (10-min);

990[hPa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pascal_(unit) "Pascal (unit)")([mbar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bar_(unit) "Bar (unit)"))

During August 3, the JMA reported that a tropical depression had developed, about 720 km (445 mi) to the northwest of Wake Island.[[215]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-Kirogi_BT-216) Over the next day the system gradually developed further, before the JTWC started to monitor the system as Tropical Depression 13W, late on August 4.[[216]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-Prog_1-217)[[217]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-13W_BT-218)

On August 5, the JTWC upgraded the system to a tropical storm.[[218]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-219) Early on August 6, the JMA reported that the system had become extratropical.[[219]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-220) However, the JMA designated it as a tropical storm with the name _Kirogi_ early on August 8.[[220]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-221) Early on August 9, the JTWC downgraded Kirogi to a tropical depression.[[221]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-222) Later, the JMA upgraded Kirogi to a severe tropical storm, it reached its peak intensity,[[222]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-223) while the JTWC upgraded it to a tropical storm again.[[223]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-224) Later that day, the JTWC issued its final warning on Kirogi as it transitioned from a warm cored tropical system to a cold cored subtropical system.[[224]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-225) The remnants of the system then entered the [Sea of Okhotsk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_of_Okhotsk "Sea of Okhotsk").[[225]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-226)

triples.sentence: During August 3, the JMA reported that a tropical depression had developed, about 720 km (445 mi) to the northwest of Wake Island.[[215]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-Kirogi_BT-216)
triples.statement: On August 3, the JMA reported that a tropical depression had formed approximately 720 km (445 mi) northwest of Wake Island.

triples.sentence: Over the next day the system gradually developed further, before the JTWC started to monitor the system as Tropical Depression 13W, late on August 4.[[216]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-Prog_1-217)[[217]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-13W_BT-218)
triples.statement: The system continued to develop, and the JTWC began monitoring it as Tropical Depression 13W late on August 4.

triples.sentence: On August 5, the JTWC upgraded the system to a tropical storm.[[218]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-219)
triples.statement: On August 5, the JTWC upgraded the system to a tropical storm.

triples.sentence: Early on August 6, the JMA reported that the system had become extratropical.[[219]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-220)
triples.statement: The JMA reported that the system had become extratropical early on August 6.

triples.sentence: However, the JMA designated it as a tropical storm with the name _Kirogi_ early on August 8.[[220]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-221)
triples.statement: Despite its extratropical transition, the JMA named the system Tropical Storm Kirogi early on August 8.

triples.sentence: Early on August 9, the JTWC downgraded Kirogi to a tropical depression.[[221]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-222)
triples.statement: The JTWC downgraded Kirogi to a tropical depression early on August 9.

triples.sentence: Later, the JMA upgraded Kirogi to a severe tropical storm, it reached its peak intensity,[[222]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-223) while the JTWC upgraded it to a tropical storm again.[[223]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-224)
triples.statement: Later, the JMA upgraded Kirogi to a severe tropical storm as it reached its peak intensity, while the JTWC re-upgraded it to a tropical storm.

triples.sentence: Later that day, the JTWC issued its final warning on Kirogi as it transitioned from a warm cored tropical system to a cold cored subtropical system.[[224]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-225)
triples.statement: Later that day, the JTWC issued its final warning on Kirogi as it transitioned into a subtropical system.

triples.sentence: The remnants of the system then entered the [Sea of Okhotsk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sea_of_Okhotsk "Sea of Okhotsk").[[225]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-226)
triples.statement: The remnants of the system subsequently entered the Sea of Okhotsk.

section_body:
[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2012_Pacific_typhoon_season&action=edit&section=17 "Edit section: Typhoon Kai-tak (Helen)")]

Typhoon(JMA)
Category 1 typhoon(SSHWS)
[![Image 33](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d2/Kai-tak_Aug_17_2012.jpg/250px-Kai-tak_Aug_17_2012.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Kai-tak_Aug_17_2012.jpg)[![Image 34](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/Kai-tak_2012_track.png/250px-Kai-tak_2012_track.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Kai-tak_2012_track.png)
Duration August 12– August 18
Peak intensity 120 km/h (75 mph) (10-min);

970[hPa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pascal_(unit) "Pascal (unit)")([mbar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bar_(unit) "Bar (unit)"))

Main article: [Typhoon Kai-tak (2012)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Typhoon_Kai-tak_(2012) "Typhoon Kai-tak (2012)")

The monsoonal trough spawned a tropical disturbance early on August 10,[[226]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-227) which had organizing convection and a weak circulation.[[227]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-228) Early on August 12, the [Japan Meteorological Agency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japan_Meteorological_Agency "Japan Meteorological Agency") (JMA) started tracking the system as a weak Tropical Depression with winds under 30 knots.[[228]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-229)[Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philippine_Atmospheric,_Geophysical_and_Astronomical_Services_Administration "Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration") (PAGASA) started issuing advisories on the system, naming it _Helen_.[[229]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-230) That day, the JTWC also initiated advisories on Tropical Depression 14W.[[230]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-231) Early on August 13, the JMA upgraded the depression to Tropical Storm Kai-tak (_1213_).[[231]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-232) and 9 hours later the JTWC followed suit.[[232]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-233) Later the same day, the JMA upgraded it to a Severe Tropical Storm.[[233]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-234) On August 15, the convection increased as outflow improved, and the JTWC upgraded Kai-tak to a typhoon.[[234]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-235) The storm continued towards China, with deepening convection due to decreasing wind shear.[[235]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-236) However, it was only at 0000 UTC on August 16 when the JMA officially declared Kai-tak a typhoon.[[236]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-237) At the same time, the PAGASA issued their last warning on Kai-tak, otherwise known as Helen, locally, as it left the Philippine area of Responsibility.[[237]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-238)

On the morning of August 17, Kai-tak made landfall over the [Leizhou peninsula](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leizhou_Peninsula "Leizhou Peninsula") in southern China as a typhoon.[[238]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-239) Within 6 hours, Kai-tak made a second landfall over the northeast coast of Vietnam and weakened slightly to a tropical storm.[[239]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-240) Later that night, the JTWC issued their final warning on the system as it weakened further and sped up inland.[[240]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-241) The JMA stopped tracking the storm early the next morning, no longer considering it a tropical cyclone.[[241]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-242)

section_body:
[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2012_Pacific_typhoon_season&action=edit&section=18 "Edit section: Typhoon Tembin (Igme)")]

Typhoon(JMA)
Category 4 typhoon(SSHWS)
[![Image 35](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/57/Tembin_Aug_20_2012_0235Z.jpg/250px-Tembin_Aug_20_2012_0235Z.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Tembin_Aug_20_2012_0235Z.jpg)[![Image 36](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b6/Tembin_2012_track.png/250px-Tembin_2012_track.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Tembin_2012_track.png)
Duration August 17– August 30
Peak intensity 150 km/h (90 mph) (10-min);

950[hPa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pascal_(unit) "Pascal (unit)")([mbar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bar_(unit) "Bar (unit)"))

Main article: [Typhoon Tembin (2012)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Typhoon_Tembin_(2012) "Typhoon Tembin (2012)")

On August 16, a tropical disturbance formed southeast of [Taiwan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taiwan "Taiwan").[[242]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-243) On August 17, the JMA mentioned it as a tropical depression, as a [subtropical ridge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Subtropical_ridge "Subtropical ridge") pushed the system southwards.[[243]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-244) The JTWC issued a [TCFA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tropical_Cyclone_Formation_Alert "Tropical Cyclone Formation Alert") on the system late on August 18;[[244]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-245) early on the next day, the JMA upgraded it to a tropical storm and named it _Tembin_, and the JTWC upgraded it to a tropical depression.[[245]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-246)[[246]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-247) Soon, the PAGASA also upgraded it to a tropical depression and named it _Igme_.[[247]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-248) On August 20, Tembin entered a period of [explosive intensification](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rapid_deepening "Rapid deepening") by excellent dual outflow, prompting both the JMA and the JTWC upgrading it to a typhoon.[[248]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-249)[[249]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-250) By the end of the same day, Tembin reached its initial peak intensity as a Category 4 typhoon,[[250]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-251) before it started to weaken by the next day as a [TUTT](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tropical_upper_tropospheric_trough "Tropical upper tropospheric trough") cell developed over the system.[[251]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-252)

On August 22, Tembin began reintensify, as an eye feature was forming once again.[[252]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-253) By the next day, Tembin re-intensified into a category 3 typhoon,[[253]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-254) before it made landfall over [Pingtung](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pingtung_County "Pingtung County"), [Taiwan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taiwan "Taiwan") later on the same day.[[254]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-255) Due to land interaction, the JMA downgraded Tembin to a severe tropical storm early on August 24,[[255]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-256) and the JTWC downgraded it to a tropical storm later.[[256]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-257) Soon, the JTWC upgraded Tembin to a typhoon when it moved into the [South China Sea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_China_Sea "South China Sea").[[257]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-258) Late on August 25, the JMA upgraded Tembin to a typhoon again,[[258]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-259) and the system intensified into a category 2 typhoon early on the next day.[[259]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-260) Afterwards, Typhoon Tembin interacted with the nearby [Typhoon Bolaven](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Typhoon_Bolaven_(2012) "Typhoon Bolaven (2012)").[[260]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-261) Over the next few days, Tembin made a counterclockwise loop eastward,[[261]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-262) moving back into the Philippine Area of Responsibility (PAR) in the process, causing more rainfall over in the Philippines.[[262]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-263) Afterwards, the JTWC downgraded the system to a tropical storm late on August 27, as it turned north-northeastward.[[263]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-264) The JMA soon downgraded it to a severe tropical storm by the next day.[[264]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-265) On August 30, Tembin made landfall on [South Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korea "South Korea"),[[265]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-266)[[266]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-267) and transitioned into an extratropical storm.[[267]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-268)

triples.sentence: On August 16, a tropical disturbance formed southeast of [Taiwan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taiwan "Taiwan").[[242]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-243)

triples.statement: On August 17, the JMA classified the system as a tropical depression as it was pushed southwards by a subtropical ridge.

triples.sentence: The JTWC issued a [TCFA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tropical_Cyclone_Formation_Alert "Tropical Cyclone Formation Alert") on the system late on August 18;[[244]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-245) early on the next day, the JMA upgraded it to a tropical storm and named it _Tembin_, and the JTWC upgraded it to a tropical depression.[[245]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-246)[[246]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-247)
triples.statement: The JTWC issued a Tropical Cyclone Formation Alert late on August 18, and early the next day, the JMA upgraded the system to Tropical Storm Tembin while the JTWC upgraded it to a tropical depression.

triples.sentence: Soon, the PAGASA also upgraded it to a tropical depression and named it _Igme_.[[247]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-248)
triples.statement: PAGASA upgraded the system to a tropical depression, naming it Igme.

triples.sentence: On August 20, Tembin entered a period of [explosive intensification](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rapid_deepening "Rapid deepening") by excellent dual outflow, prompting both the JMA and the JTWC upgrading it to a typhoon.[[248]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-249)[[249]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-250)
triples.statement: On August 20, Tembin underwent explosive intensification due to excellent dual outflow, leading both the JMA and JTWC to upgrade it to a typhoon.

triples.sentence: By the end of the same day, Tembin reached its initial peak intensity as a Category 4 typhoon,[[250]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-251) before it started to weaken by the next day as a [TUTT](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tropical_upper_tropospheric_trough "Tropical upper tropospheric trough") cell developed over the system.[[251]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-252)
triples.statement: By the end of August 20, Tembin reached its initial peak as a Category 4 typhoon, but began to weaken the next day due to the development of a TUTT cell.

triples.sentence: On August 22, Tembin began reintensify, as an eye feature was forming once again.[[252]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-253)
triples.statement: On August 22, Tembin started to re-intensify as an eye feature reformed.

triples.sentence: By the next day, Tembin re-intensified into a category 3 typhoon,[[253]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-254) before it made landfall over [Pingtung](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pingtung_County "Pingtung County"), [Taiwan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taiwan "Taiwan") later on the same day.[[254]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-255)
triples.statement: The following day, Tembin re-intensified to a Category 3 typhoon and later made landfall over Pingtung, Taiwan.

triples.sentence: Due to land interaction, the JMA downgraded Tembin to a severe tropical storm early on August 24,[[255]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-256) and the JTWC downgraded it to a tropical storm later.[[256]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-257)
triples.statement: Due to interaction with land, the JMA downgraded Tembin to a severe tropical storm early on August 24, and the JTWC later downgraded it to a tropical storm.

triples.sentence: Soon, the JTWC upgraded Tembin to a typhoon when it moved into the [South China Sea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_China_Sea "South China Sea").[[257]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-258)
triples.statement: The JTWC upgraded Tembin back to a typhoon as it entered the South China Sea.

triples.sentence: Late on August 25, the JMA upgraded Tembin to a typhoon again,[[258]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-259) and the system intensified into a category 2 typhoon early on the next day.[[259]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-260)
triples.statement: The JMA re-upgraded Tembin to a typhoon late on August 25, and it intensified into a Category 2 typhoon early the next day.

triples.sentence: Afterwards, Typhoon Tembin interacted with the nearby [Typhoon Bolaven](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Typhoon_Bolaven_(2012) "Typhoon Bolaven (2012)").[[260]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-261)
triples.statement: Typhoon Tembin then interacted with the nearby Typhoon Bolaven.

triples.sentence: Over the next few days, Tembin made a counterclockwise loop eastward,[[261]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-262) moving back into the Philippine Area of Responsibility (PAR) in the process, causing more rainfall over in the Philippines.[[262]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-263)
triples.statement: Over the following days, Tembin executed a counterclockwise loop eastward, re-entering the Philippine Area of Responsibility and causing more rain in the Philippines.

triples.sentence: Afterwards, the JTWC downgraded the system to a tropical storm late on August 27, as it turned north-northeastward.[[263]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-264)
triples.statement: The JTWC downgraded the system to a tropical storm late on August 27 as it moved north-northeast.

triples.sentence: The JMA soon downgraded it to a severe tropical storm by the next day.[[264]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-265)
triples.statement: The JMA downgraded it to a severe tropical storm the following day.

triples.sentence: On August 30, Tembin made landfall on [South Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korea "South Korea"),[[265]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-266)[[266]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-267) and transitioned into an extratropical storm.[[267]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-268)
triples.statement: On August 30, Tembin made landfall in South Korea and became an extratropical storm.

section_body:
[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2012_Pacific_typhoon_season&action=edit&section=19 "Edit section: Typhoon Bolaven (Julian)")]

Very strong typhoon(JMA)
Category 4 typhoon(SSHWS)
[![Image 37](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e9/Bolaven_2012-08-25_0420Z_%28cropped%29.jpg/250px-Bolaven_2012-08-25_0420Z_%28cropped%29.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bolaven_2012-08-25_0420Z_(cropped).jpg)[![Image 38](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/36/Bolaven_2012_track.png/250px-Bolaven_2012_track.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Bolaven_2012_track.png)
Duration August 19– August 29
Peak intensity 185 km/h (115 mph) (10-min);

910[hPa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pascal_(unit) "Pascal (unit)")([mbar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bar_(unit) "Bar (unit)"))

Main article: [Typhoon Bolaven (2012)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Typhoon_Bolaven_(2012) "Typhoon Bolaven (2012)")

Forming as a tropical depression on August 19 to the southwest of the [Mariana Islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mariana_Islands "Mariana Islands"),[[268]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-269) Bolaven steadily intensified as it slowly moved west-northwestward in a region favoring tropical development. The system was soon upgraded to a tropical storm less than a day after formation and further to a typhoon by August 21.[[269]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-270)[[270]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-271) Strengthening became more gradual thereafter as Bolaven grew in size.[[271]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-272) On August 24, the system attained its peak intensity with winds of 185 km/h (115 mph) and a [barometric pressure](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barometric_pressure "Barometric pressure") of 910[mbar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bar_(unit) "Bar (unit)") ([hPa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pascal_(unit) "Pascal (unit)"); 26.87[inHg](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Inches_of_Mercury "Inches of Mercury")). Weakening only slightly, the storm passed directly over [Okinawa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Okinawa_Island "Okinawa Island") on August 26 as it began accelerating toward the north.[[272]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-273)[[273]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-274)[[274]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-275) Steady weakening continued as Bolaven approached the [Korean Peninsula](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korean_Peninsula "Korean Peninsula") and it eventually made [landfall](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Landfall_(meteorology) "Landfall (meteorology)") in [North Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Korea "North Korea") late on August 28 before transitioning into an [extratropical cyclone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Extratropical_cyclone "Extratropical cyclone").[[275]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-276) The remnants rapidly tracked northeastward and was last noted over the [Russian Far East](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Far_East "Russian Far East").[[276]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-277)

Although Bolaven struck the [Ryukyu Islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ryukyu_Islands "Ryukyu Islands") as a powerful typhoon, damage was less than expected. Relatively few buildings were damaged or destroyed across the region.[[277]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-278) The most significant effects stemmed from heavy rains, amounting to 551.5 mm (21.71 in), that caused flash flooding and landslides.[[278]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-279) One person drowned on [Amami Ōshima](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amami_%C5%8Cshima "Amami Ōshima") after being swept away by a swollen river.[[279]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-280) In mainland Japan, two people drowned after being swept away by rough seas.[[280]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-281)[[281]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-282) In [South Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korea "South Korea"), 19 people were killed by the storm. Many buildings were damaged and approximately 1.9 million homes were left without power.[[282]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-283)[[283]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-284) Losses in the country reached [₩](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/South_Korean_won "South Korean won")420 billion (US$374.3 million), the majority of which was due to destroyed apple orchards.[[284]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-285) Significant damage also took place in [North Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Korea "North Korea") where at least 59 people were killed and 50 others were reported missing.[[285]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-286) Additionally, 6,700 homes were destroyed. Offshore, nine people drowned after two Chinese vessels sank.[[286]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-287) Total economic losses in China were counted to be CNY 19.82 billion (US$3.126 billion).[[128]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-China_Member_Report-129)

triples.sentence: Weakening only slightly, the storm passed directly over [Okinawa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Okinawa_Island "Okinawa Island") on August 26 as it began accelerating toward the north.[[272]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-273)[[273]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-274)[[274]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-275)

triples.sentence: Steady weakening continued as Bolaven approached the [Korean Peninsula](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Korean_Peninsula "Korean Peninsula") and it eventually made [landfall](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Landfall_(meteorology) "Landfall (meteorology)") in [North Korea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/North_Korea "North Korea") late on August 28 before transitioning into an [extratropical cyclone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Extratropical_cyclone "Extratropical cyclone").[[275]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-276)
triples.statement: Bolaven continued to weaken as it approached the Korean Peninsula, making landfall in North Korea late on August 28 before becoming an extratropical cyclone.

triples.sentence: The remnants rapidly tracked northeastward and was last noted over the [Russian Far East](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_Far_East "Russian Far East").[[276]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-277)
triples.statement: The storm's remnants moved quickly to the northeast and were last observed over the Russian Far East.

triples.sentence: The most significant effects stemmed from heavy rains, amounting to 551.5 mm (21.71 in), that caused flash flooding and landslides.[[278]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-279)
triples.statement: The most significant impacts were from heavy rains of up to 551.5 mm (21.71 in), which led to flash floods and landslides.

triples.sentence: One person drowned on [Amami Ōshima](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amami_%C5%8Cshima "Amami Ōshima") after being swept away by a swollen river.[[279]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-280)
triples.statement: On Amami Ōshima, one person drowned after being swept away by a swollen river.

triples.sentence: In mainland Japan, two people drowned after being swept away by rough seas.[[280]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-281)[[281]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-282)
triples.statement: Two people drowned in mainland Japan after being swept away by rough seas.

section_body:
[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2012_Pacific_typhoon_season&action=edit&section=20 "Edit section: Typhoon Sanba (Karen)")]

Violent typhoon(JMA)
Category 5 super typhoon(SSHWS)
[![Image 39](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/94/Sanba_2012-09-14_0101Z.jpg/250px-Sanba_2012-09-14_0101Z.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Sanba_2012-09-14_0101Z.jpg)[![Image 40](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/07/Sanba_2012_path.png/250px-Sanba_2012_path.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Sanba_2012_path.png)
Duration September 10– September 18
Peak intensity 205 km/h (125 mph) (10-min);

900[hPa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pascal_(unit) "Pascal (unit)")([mbar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bar_(unit) "Bar (unit)"))

Main article: [Typhoon Sanba](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Typhoon_Sanba "Typhoon Sanba")

A low-pressure area formed east of [Palau](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Palau "Palau") on September 9.[[287]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-288) On September 10, both the JMA and the JTWC upgraded it to a tropical depression.[[288]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-289)[[289]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-290)[[290]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-291) As the system entered the PAR early on September 11, the PAGASA named it _Karen_.[[291]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-292) At the same time, the JMA upgraded the system to a tropical storm and named it _Sanba_, and the JTWC also upgraded it to a tropical storm later.[[292]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-293) Late on September 12, Sanba began [explosive intensification](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rapid_deepening "Rapid deepening"), prompting the JMA upgrading it to a severe tropical storm and even a typhoon later.[[293]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-294)[[294]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-295) On September 13, the JTWC reported that Sanba rapidly strengthened into a category 5 super typhoon, the strongest since [Megi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Typhoon_Megi_(2010) "Typhoon Megi (2010)") in 2010.[[295]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-296) By the next day, the system started to weaken as it had undergone an eyewall replacement cycle.[[296]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-297) It soon ended up with a 57 kilometer-wide eye.[[297]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-298) On September 17, Sanba made landfall over South Korea.[[298]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-299)

In [Kōchi Prefecture](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/K%C5%8Dchi_Prefecture "Kōchi Prefecture"), Japan, 222 hectares (548 acres) of agricultural land was damaged by the storm, with losses reaching [¥](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_yen "Japanese yen")50 million (US$640 thousand).[[299]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-300) Throughout Okinawa, damage to agriculture, forestry, and fisheries amounted to ¥900 million (US$11.5 million).[[300]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-301)

section_body:
[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2012_Pacific_typhoon_season&action=edit&section=21 "Edit section: Typhoon Jelawat (Lawin)")]

Violent typhoon(JMA)
Category 5 super typhoon(SSHWS)
[![Image 41](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ed/Jelawat_2012-09-25_0210Z.jpg/250px-Jelawat_2012-09-25_0210Z.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Jelawat_2012-09-25_0210Z.jpg)[![Image 42](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3a/Jelawat_2012_track.png/250px-Jelawat_2012_track.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Jelawat_2012_track.png)
Duration September 20– October 1
Peak intensity 205 km/h (125 mph) (10-min);

905[hPa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pascal_(unit) "Pascal (unit)")([mbar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bar_(unit) "Bar (unit)"))

Main article: [Typhoon Jelawat (2012)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Typhoon_Jelawat_(2012) "Typhoon Jelawat (2012)")

On September 18, a tropical disturbance formed to the east of [Guam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guam "Guam").[[301]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-302) Late on the next day, the JTWC issued a TCFA on the system.[[302]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-303) By September 20, both the JMA and the PAGASA upgraded the low-pressure area to a tropical depression, with the latter naming it as _Lawin_.[[303]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-304)[[304]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-305) The JTWC subsequently followed suit and upgraded it to a tropical depression.[[305]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-306) Late on the same day, the JMA upgraded the system to a tropical storm and named it _Jelawat_, and so did the JTWC.[[306]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-307)[[307]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-308) Half a day later, the JMA upgraded Jelawat to a severe tropical storm.[[308]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-309) Early on September 23, both the JMA and the JTWC upgraded Jelawat to a typhoon.[[309]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-310)[[310]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-311) It started to undergo [explosive intensification](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rapid_deepening "Rapid deepening"), becoming a category 4 typhoon in 12 hours, as it developed a small eye.[[311]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-312) Late on September 24, as Jelawat developed a 19-kilometre-wide (12 mi) eye, the JTWC upgraded the system to a category 5-equivalent super typhoon.[[312]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-313) By the next day, the system started its eyewall replacement cycle.[[313]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-314) By September 26, it weakened to a Category 4 super typhoon as it completed the cycle,[[314]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-315) with its eye becoming 74 kilometers across by the next day.[[315]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-316) On September 28, it started another eyewall replacement cycle.[[316]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-317) This led to the system weakening to a category 3-equivalent typhoon,[[317]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-318) and a category 2-equivalent system on the next day due to cooling sea surface temperatures.[[318]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-319) It further weakened to a category 1-equivalent typhoon late on the same day.[[319]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-320) On September 30, the JTWC downgraded Jelawat to a tropical storm,[[320]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-321) before it made landfall on Japan a few hours later.[[321]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-322) The JMA downgraded Jelawat to a severe tropical storm late on the same day, with the JTWC issuing its final advisory.[[322]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-323)[[323]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-324) The JMA further downgraded the system to a tropical storm by the next day,[[324]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-325) before it fully became an extratropical cyclone six hours later.[[325]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-326)

triples.sentence: On September 18, a tropical disturbance formed to the east of [Guam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guam "Guam").[[301]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-302)
triples.statement: A tropical disturbance formed east of Guam on September 18.

triples.sentence: Late on the next day, the JTWC issued a TCFA on the system.[[302]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-303)

triples.sentence: The JTWC subsequently followed suit and upgraded it to a tropical depression.[[305]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-306)
triples.statement: The JTWC subsequently upgraded the system to a tropical depression.

triples.sentence: Late on the same day, the JMA upgraded the system to a tropical storm and named it _Jelawat_, and so did the JTWC.[[306]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-307)[[307]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-308)
triples.statement: Late on the same day, the JMA upgraded the system to a tropical storm and named it Jelawat, and the JTWC did as well.

triples.sentence: Half a day later, the JMA upgraded Jelawat to a severe tropical storm.[[308]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-309)
triples.statement: Half a day later, the JMA upgraded Jelawat to a severe tropical storm.

triples.sentence: Early on September 23, both the JMA and the JTWC upgraded Jelawat to a typhoon.[[309]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-310)[[310]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-311)
triples.statement: Early on September 23, both the JMA and the JTWC upgraded Jelawat to a typhoon.

triples.sentence: It started to undergo [explosive intensification](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rapid_deepening "Rapid deepening"), becoming a category 4 typhoon in 12 hours, as it developed a small eye.[[311]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-312)
triples.statement: The storm underwent explosive intensification, becoming a category 4 typhoon in 12 hours as it developed a small eye.

triples.sentence: Late on September 24, as Jelawat developed a 19-kilometre-wide (12 mi) eye, the JTWC upgraded the system to a category 5-equivalent super typhoon.[[312]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-313)
triples.statement: Late on September 24, as Jelawat developed a 19-kilometre-wide (12 mi) eye, the JTWC upgraded the system to a category 5-equivalent super typhoon.

triples.sentence: By the next day, the system started its eyewall replacement cycle.[[313]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-314)
triples.statement: By the next day, the system started its eyewall replacement cycle.

triples.sentence: By September 26, it weakened to a Category 4 super typhoon as it completed the cycle,[[314]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-315) with its eye becoming 74 kilometers across by the next day.[[315]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-316)
triples.statement: By September 26, Jelawat weakened to a Category 4 super typhoon as it completed its eyewall replacement cycle, with its eye growing to 74 kilometers across by the next day.

triples.sentence: On September 28, it started another eyewall replacement cycle.[[316]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-317)
triples.statement: On September 28, the storm started another eyewall replacement cycle.

triples.sentence: This led to the system weakening to a category 3-equivalent typhoon,[[317]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-318) and a category 2-equivalent system on the next day due to cooling sea surface temperatures.[[318]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-319)
triples.statement: This led to the system weakening to a category 3-equivalent typhoon, and then to a category 2-equivalent system the next day due to cooling sea surface temperatures.

triples.sentence: It further weakened to a category 1-equivalent typhoon late on the same day.[[319]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-320)
triples.statement: It further weakened to a category 1-equivalent typhoon late on the same day.

triples.sentence: On September 30, the JTWC downgraded Jelawat to a tropical storm,[[320]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-321) before it made landfall on Japan a few hours later.[[321]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-322)
triples.statement: On September 30, the JTWC downgraded Jelawat to a tropical storm, before it made landfall on Japan a few hours later.

triples.sentence: The JMA downgraded Jelawat to a severe tropical storm late on the same day, with the JTWC issuing its final advisory.[[322]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-323)[[323]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-324)
triples.statement: The JMA downgraded Jelawat to a severe tropical storm late on the same day, with the JTWC issuing its final advisory.

triples.sentence: The JMA further downgraded the system to a tropical storm by the next day,[[324]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-325) before it fully became an extratropical cyclone six hours later.[[325]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-326)
triples.statement: The JMA further downgraded the system to a tropical storm by the next day, before it fully became an extratropical cyclone six hours later.

section_body:
[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2012_Pacific_typhoon_season&action=edit&section=22 "Edit section: Severe Tropical Storm Ewiniar")]

Severe tropical storm(JMA)
Tropical storm(SSHWS)
[![Image 43](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d9/Ewiniar_Sept_27_2012_0325Z.jpg/250px-Ewiniar_Sept_27_2012_0325Z.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Ewiniar_Sept_27_2012_0325Z.jpg)[![Image 44](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/88/Ewiniar_2012_track.png/250px-Ewiniar_2012_track.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Ewiniar_2012_track.png)
Duration September 23– September 30
Peak intensity 95 km/h (60 mph) (10-min);

985[hPa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pascal_(unit) "Pascal (unit)")([mbar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bar_(unit) "Bar (unit)"))

On September 22, the JTWC reported that a low-pressure area was developing to the west of Guam, around 650 nautical miles (1,200 km) east-northeast of Typhoon Jelawat.[[326]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-327) By the next day, the JMA upgraded it to a tropical depression.[[327]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-328) On September 24, the JTWC upgraded the system to a tropical depression, although deep convection was displaced to the south due to moderate vertical wind shear associated with Jelawat, leaving its low-level circulation center exposed.[[328]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-329)[[329]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-330) The center then began to consolidate, with deep convection wrapping over its eastern quadrant, prompting both the JMA and the JTWC to upgrade the system to a tropical storm, with the former naming it as _Ewiniar_.[[330]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-331)[[331]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-332)

Moving north-northeastward along the periphery of the subtropical ridge, Ewiniar's center continued to be displaced from the main convection due to moderate wind shear.[[332]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-333) By September 26, Ewiniar struggled to maintain its deep convection due to the continued effects of wind shear.[[333]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-334) Despite that, the JMA upgraded Ewiniar into a severe tropical storm.[[334]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-335) On the next day, the system reached peak intensity as it turned northward, with weakening convection wrapping to its center,[[335]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-336) before it became embedded within a subtropical trough.[[336]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-337) However, deep convection wrapped the system as it became quasi-stationary late on the same day,[[337]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-338) before returning to a northeastward track soon after.[[338]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-339) By the next day, Ewiniar's center became partially exposed, and it began to weaken.[[339]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-340)[[340]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-341) On September 29, the JMA downgraded the system to a tropical storm, as convection was being displaced to the northeast of its center by strong vertical wind shear.[[341]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-342)[[342]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-343) The JTWC issued their final advisory on the same day, as Ewiniar's center fully separated from its convection, and had undergone extratropical transition.[[343]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-344) Ewiniar then became extratropical by the next day.[[344]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-345)

triples.sentence: However, deep convection wrapped the system as it became quasi-stationary late on the same day,[[337]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-338) before returning to a northeastward track soon after.[[338]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-339)
triples.statement: Later that day, deep convection enveloped the system as it became quasi-stationary, before it resumed a northeastward track shortly thereafter.

triples.sentence: By the next day, Ewiniar's center became partially exposed, and it began to weaken.[[339]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-340)[[340]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-341)
triples.statement: By the following day, Ewiniar's center was partially exposed, and the storm started to weaken.

triples.sentence: On September 29, the JMA downgraded the system to a tropical storm, as convection was being displaced to the northeast of its center by strong vertical wind shear.[[341]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-342)[[342]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-343)
triples.statement: On September 29, the JMA downgraded the system to a tropical storm as strong vertical wind shear displaced its convection to the northeast of the center.

triples.sentence: The JTWC issued their final advisory on the same day, as Ewiniar's center fully separated from its convection, and had undergone extratropical transition.[[343]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-344)
triples.statement: The JTWC issued its final advisory on the same day, as Ewiniar's center had completely separated from its convection and was undergoing extratropical transition.

triples.sentence: Ewiniar then became extratropical by the next day.[[344]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-345)

section_body:
[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2012_Pacific_typhoon_season&action=edit&section=23 "Edit section: Severe Tropical Storm Maliksi")]

Severe tropical storm(JMA)
Tropical storm(SSHWS)
[![Image 45](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ae/Maliksi_Oct_03_2012.jpg/250px-Maliksi_Oct_03_2012.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Maliksi_Oct_03_2012.jpg)[![Image 46](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/04/Maliksi_2012_track.png/250px-Maliksi_2012_track.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Maliksi_2012_track.png)
Duration September 29– October 4
Peak intensity 95 km/h (60 mph) (10-min);

985[hPa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pascal_(unit) "Pascal (unit)")([mbar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bar_(unit) "Bar (unit)"))

On September 28, the JTWC started to monitor an area of convection approximately 80 nautical miles (150 km) to the northwest of Chuuk. At the time, it had a broad but slowly developing low-level circulation center, and was under a marginal environment of warm sea surface temperatures, weak vertical wind shear and limited poleward outflow.[[345]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-346) As the system's center began to consolidate,[[346]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-ABPW_0929-347) the JMA upgraded it to a tropical depression by the next day.[[347]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-348) Half a day later, the JTWC issued a TCFA on the system, as its center became better defined, with convection wrapping into it,[[348]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-349) before it subsequently upgraded the system to a tropical depression, designating it as 20W.[[349]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-350) As the system continued to organize itself, the JMA upgraded it to a tropical storm by October 1, naming it as _Maliksi_.[[350]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-351)[[351]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-352) The JTWC subsequently followed suit, although its deep convection to the southeast were yet to wrap towards its center.[[352]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-353)

Moving northwestward under the southwest periphery of the subtropical ridge, Maliksi continued to improve its center by the next day, with convective banding wrapping tightly towards it.[[353]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-354) However, microwave imagery showed the system had become less organized 12 hours later, with its center becoming elongated.[[354]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-355) Nonetheless, the JMA upgraded Maliksi to a severe tropical storm late on the same day, as it began to improve once again.[[355]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-356)[[356]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-357) As it turned to the northeast, deep convection from the system became isolated to the east, due to increasing wind shear and unfavorable conditions as it started transitioning to an extratropical system.[[357]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-358) As a result, the JTWC issued their final advisory on Maliksi late on October 3, as convection became greatly sheared to the northeast.[[358]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-359) The system then became fully extratropical by the next day.[[359]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-360) The extratropical system went on to merge with a front, becoming an intense hurricane-force low on October 5, before reforming near the [Aleutian Islands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aleutian_Islands "Aleutian Islands") and dissipating near [Alaska](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alaska "Alaska") on October 11.[[360]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-361)

As the system was developing near the Mariana Islands, tropical storm warnings were issued in [Alamagan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alamagan "Alamagan"), [Pagan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pagan "Pagan") and [Agrihan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Agrihan "Agrihan") on October 1.[[361]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-362) However, as Maliksi moved northwest, the warnings were cancelled by the next day.[[362]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-363)

triples.statement: The system became fully extratropical by the next day.

section_body:
[[edit](https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2012_Pacific_typhoon_season&action=edit&section=24 "Edit section: Severe Tropical Storm Gaemi (Marce)")]

Severe tropical storm(JMA)
Tropical storm(SSHWS)
[![Image 47](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/56/Gaemi_Oct_03_2012_0300Z.jpg/250px-Gaemi_Oct_03_2012_0300Z.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Gaemi_Oct_03_2012_0300Z.jpg)[![Image 48](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f6/Gaemi_2012_track.png/250px-Gaemi_2012_track.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Gaemi_2012_track.png)
Duration September 29– October 7
Peak intensity 95 km/h (60 mph) (10-min);

990[hPa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pascal_(unit) "Pascal (unit)")([mbar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bar_(unit) "Bar (unit)"))

Main article: [Tropical Storm Gaemi (2012)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tropical_Storm_Gaemi_(2012) "Tropical Storm Gaemi (2012)")

On September 29, the JTWC started to monitor an area of convection, within a monsoon trough, approximately 325 nmi (602 km) to the southeast of [Huế](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hu%E1%BA%BF "Huế"), [Vietnam](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vietnam "Vietnam"). At the time, it already had an organizing low-level circulation center, and was within a low to moderate wind shear environment.[[346]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-ABPW_0929-347)[[363]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-364) The JMA soon upgraded it to a tropical depression.[[364]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-365) As the depression became quasi-stationary, deep convection consolidated over its center, prompting the JTWC to issue a TCFA by the next day.[[365]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-366) On October 1, the JMA upgraded the system into a tropical storm, naming it as _Gaemi_.[[366]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-367) At the same time, the JTWC started issuing advisories on Gaemi as a tropical depression,[[367]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-368) before subsequently upgrading it to a tropical storm, as a [scatterometer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scatterometer "Scatterometer") pass indicated gale-force winds within the system.[[368]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-369)

Within a weak steering environment, Gaemi moved southward under the influence of a near-equatorial ridge, as it continued to improve.[[369]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-370) By the next day, Gaemi entered the Philippine Area of Responsibility (PAR) as deep convection continued to wrap the system, with the PAGASA assigning its local name _Marce_.[[370]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-371)[[371]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-372) With a central dense overcast over the system's center,[[372]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-373) the JMA upgraded Gaemi to a severe tropical storm on October 3, as it turned to the west-southwest as a building subtropical ridge to the north took command of the system's steering influence.[[373]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-374)[[374]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-Gaemi_8-375) The JTWC originally anticipated the storm to strengthen into a typhoon under favorable conditions,[[374]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-Gaemi_8-375) however, increasing easterly wind shear sheared the system's convection to the west as it turned east by the next day, with its center becoming fully exposed.[[375]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-376) As a result, the JMA downgraded Gaemi to a tropical storm.[[376]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-377) Returning to a westward track,[[377]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-378) Gaemi remained fully exposed by October 5, and was deteriorating under the continued effects of wind shear.[[378]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-379) Later that same day, it exited the PAR, with the PAGASA issuing their final advisory on the storm.[[379]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-380) Gaemi then slightly reintensified by the next day, with deep convection covering its center but most of the convection remained isolated to its west.[[380]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-381) At 6:00 pm [ICT](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indochina_Time "Indochina Time") (11:00 UTC), it made landfall over [Phú Yên Province](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ph%C3%BA_Y%C3%AAn_Province "Phú Yên Province") in Vietnam.[[381]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-Vietnam-382) The JMA subsequently downgraded Gaemi to a tropical depression,[[382]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-383) with the JTWC issuing their final advisory on the system.[[383]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-384) The remnants then spawned an area of convection that developed into [Depression BOB 01](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_North_Indian_Ocean_cyclone_season#Depression_BOB_01 "2012 North Indian Ocean cyclone season") in the Bay of Bengal.[[384]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-385)

As Gaemi, locally known as Marce, moved near the Philippines, signal #1 warnings were issued in [Bataan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bataan "Bataan") and [Zambales](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zambales "Zambales").[[385]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-386) The storm brought heavy rainfall, resulting in a dike partially collapsing in [Occidental Mindoro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Occidental_Mindoro "Occidental Mindoro") and the evacuation of 5 families. 14 student-mountaineers were rescued after being trapped at Papaya River Base Camp in [Mariveles, Bataan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mariveles,_Bataan "Mariveles, Bataan") due to rains caused by Gaemi.[[386]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-387) A storm surge was reported at [San Antonio, Zambales](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Antonio,_Zambales "San Antonio, Zambales") in October 3, damaging 23 houses, and in [Calintaan, Occidental Mindoro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Calintaan,_Occidental_Mindoro "Calintaan, Occidental Mindoro") in October 5, damaging 28 houses. A 59-year old fisherman was found dead along the shore of [Nasugbu, Batangas](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nasugbu,_Batangas "Nasugbu, Batangas"), after two motorbancas with 3 fishermen onboard capsized amid big waves and strong winds caused by Gaemi.[[387]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-SitRep_Marce-388) In Vietnam, the storm killed 5 people.[[41]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2012_Pacific_typhoon_season#cite_note-VNCHMFReport-42)
